name: NHL 25 Defensive Pressure Tree
description: Canonical defensive pressure system for NHL 25 using ONLY validated in-game options: Protect Net, Contain Puck, Normal, Puck Side Attack, and High Pressure. Includes strengths, weaknesses, usage rules, and matchup applications.

notes: Names must match the NHL 25 UI exactly.
Defensive Pressure affects gap control, collapse timing, and how aggressively defenders challenge attackers.
Pairs tightly with Defensive Strategy (Collapsing, Staggered, Tight Point).

Protect Net.label: Protect Net
Protect Net.description: Ultra-conservative defensive pressure prioritizing the slot and inner house. Minimal challenge, fast collapse.
weaknesses: Too passive vs skilled puck movers
Fatiguing due to long ozone time
recommended_usage: Any line with strong slot presence

Contain Puck.label: Contain Puck
Contain Puck.description: The balanced pressure setting. Forces opponents to the outside and blocks dangerous seams.

Normal.label: Normal
Normal.description: Neutral engagement pressure. Moderate challenge, moderate collapse.

Puck Side Attack.label: Puck Side Attack
Puck Side Attack.description: Aggressive puck-side defensive challenge aiming to force quick turnovers.

High Pressure.label: High Pressure
High Pressure.description: Maximum defensive pressure, fast closes, heavy puck pursuit. High-risk, high-reward.

general: Contain Puck is the safest all-around option in NHL 25.
Protect Net is used for lead protection and slot-heavy opponents.
Puck Side Attack is best for breaking cycles.
High Pressure is ONLY for low-skill teams or comeback mode.
integration_notes: Protect Net pairs best with Collapsing.
Contain Puck pairs best with Staggered.
High Pressure pairs best with Tight Point.
